alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 24 at 2:27PM CST until January 25 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog and/or freezing fog, affecting the area to varying degrees. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and central, east central, and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Low visibility could make driving conditions hazardous, along with possible freezing fog causing slick roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility will likely vary across the Advisory area, as fog will not only develop at different times, but will also vary in intensity, with many areas seeing visibility drop to 1/4 mile or less at some point, but other places holding up around 1 mile. However, even where truly dense fog might fail to develop, any fog that forms in sub-freezing temperatures could cause slick spots on roads and especially bridges for the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
